title: Chapter 1: Confusion
content:
Chapter 1:
Confusion

AFTER THE END of the opening ceremony in the gymnasium, the new third-year students returned to the classroom.

A few minutes later, the bell for the second period was about to ring.

"…It's strange."

Horikita tilted her head, looking down the hallway several times.

"What's up? You worried about something?"

Sudou, who had taken the seat diagonally behind her, asked with a hint of concern.

"I haven’t seen Ayanokouji-kun since the opening ceremony ended. It’s already time for class, and he’s still not here."

Just like usual, everyone was present in the classroom—except Ayanokouji.

Even though there were no classes after this today, this was a time when his presence was mandatory. The school would check for unexcused tardies. Horikita understood from past experiences that a single absence wouldn't result in a significant deduction of class points, but it was the first day for Class 3-A. And unlike Sudou and Ike who had histories of being late, an absence from Ayanokouji, who preferred not to stand out, was troubling.

"Come to think of it, yeah. Though, I'm pretty sure he looked normal when we left the gym?"

Sudou muttered, glancing up as he recalled the memory that occurred less than thirty minutes ago.

"Right?"

Horikita had exchanged a few words with Ayanokouji that morning when they became desk neighbors, and nothing unusual had happened then.

"Maybe he's got a stomachache and is holed up in the bathroom?"

"Well, it's not impossible."

Despite feeling a bit uncomfortable with the indelicate suggestion, it was still a plausible explanation to consider.

Still, something didn't sit right with her, and Sudou, as if remembering something, crossed his arms and gave a deep nod.

"Maybe he's pretending to be sick."

After speaking, Sudou let out a wry smile, imagining something unexpected.

"Feigning sickness? Why would you think that?"

When Horikita questioned him about his unexpected reasoning, Sudou lowered his voice by about two notches and started whispering.

"He and Karuizawa recently broke up, right? It must be pretty awkward to face each other."

"That's no reason to feign sickness—and he was normal this morning."

"Maybe when he actually came to school, it hit him like a body blow[1]? For me too, you know, when I experienced heartbreak, it really took a toll on me mentally."

He looked into Horikita's eyes, but then, feeling somewhat embarrassed, he averted his gaze.

Sudou, who had confessed to Horikita during last year's school trip, was speaking from personal experience. Horikita also thought back to Sudou's feelings at that time. Indeed, there was a certain awkwardness.

"…Is that how it is?"

Although she didn't consider herself superior in matters of love, the unavoidable reality was that there were people who dumped others and those who got dumped themselves.

For Horikita, who still lacked knowledge and experience in love, it was somewhat difficult to comprehend.

Sudou, seeing Horikita's complex expression, hurriedly scratched his head.

"Hey, I'm fine now. But, you know, Ayanokouji might also have a surprisingly delicate side to him. Being in a relationship with someone from within the same class and then breaking up with them can be quite troublesome, you know? Look, even Karuizawa seemed to be blatantly avoiding Ayanokouji since this morning."

Before spring break and up till the end of the third term, Horikita recalled the two having a closeness that only intimate lovers could have, a sense of distance that made it difficult for a third party to approach.

However, this morning in the classroom, neither of them took even a single step to close the distance between each other.

It wasn't just physically, but emotionally as well.

She reconsidered, realizing that it might indeed be true that human relationships became somewhat complicated when romance was involved.

"I understand what you're saying, but weren't both of them prepared for that when they started dating?"

She had no intention whatsoever of meddling in the affairs between girls and guys, but as a matter of fact, not everyone could part amicably. She muttered that they must've been aware of the risks.

"That's not true. No one starts dating with the assumption that they'll break up, right? I hear stories from my kouhai about how they started dating, leading up to their breakup. Now, they're struggling because they can't figure out the right distance to keep between them, you know?"

Horikita, trying not to be noticed, stole glances at Karuizawa, who was sitting in a seat near the back by the window. With a somewhat listless appearance, she was gazing out the window.

"I'd hope for them to manage at least this little bit of risk…"

Even if that were true, it was a separate issue. Being uncomfortable and thus absent or late was not something to condone.

"But… still, I don't think there's a very high likelihood either way."

Whether it was stomach pain or the shock of being dumped, Ayanokouji's demeanor remained the same as usual, she once again concluded. While it was entirely possible that he simply had a poker face and was skillfully hiding behind it, she could hardly imagine him being the type of person to do such a thing.

"Well, it's just a possibility. Cut him some slack if he's a bit late."

"Once is okay. But if it happens repeatedly, as a class, we can't just ignore it. Alright. Whatever the case, we'll understand when the time comes."

Horikita decided that, no matter the truth, it was unlikely for Ayanokouji to disappear from school without notice.

  1. [1]: In this context, a "body blow," also known as a "body shot," refers to the boxing term when punching an opponent in the torso.
